questions.question_text: Ursa Major Solar uses a validation rule to prevent invalid data. What are three conditions where this rule is used? (Choose three.)

choices.C: When records are edited and saved by a user.
choices.D: When records are deleted by a user.
choices.E: When records are submitted using web-to-lead.
choices.A: When records are updated by a workflow rule.

discussion.content: Validation rule fire when the record is saved and will not fire again if it has been updated by a workflow. So the answer is B,C and E

comments.content: So the answer should be A, B, C, E

discussion.content:
E is correct because-- Salesforce runs field validation rules before creating records submitted via Web-to-Case and only creates records that have valid values. All universally required fields must have a value before a record can be created via Web-to-Case.

A is correct too because- Validation Rules run before Workflow Rules.

So i guess we have an extra correct answer to choose from!
I think Answer should be A, B and C. Workflow action can't be successful if the validation rule fires

comments.content: Validation Rule is NOT active on Workflows
A validation rule MUST fire before a workflow rule. So correct answers are actually A, B, C, E... Strange question.

questions.question_text:
Previous Ursa Major Solar sales representatives worked on approximately 180 Accounts with billing addresses in California. These sales representatives need to retain viewing and editing access to these accounts for 1-3 months.
An Administrator needs to easily provide View and Edit access to these users for the 180 accounts.
What should the Administrator do to achieve this goal?

discussion.content: FOR ME, THE CORRECT ANS IS 'D'

comments.content: There is no such profile called Sales Representative.

choices.D: Configure a new Account Sharing Rule for the Sales Representative Profile with criteria based on Billing State equals California.
choices.B: Configure a new Account Sharing Rule for these users with criteria based on Billing State equals California.
choices.A: Configure a new Profile for these users with criteria based on Billing State equals California.
choices.C: Configure a new Account folder for these users with criteria based on Billing State equals California.
